headers.text: Muhammad's order and reason for expedition

rows.text: Raid Quraysh caravan to relieve themselves from poverty
Raid Quraysh caravan to relieve themselves from poverty
Attack a Quraysh caravan which included camels
Raid a Quraysh caravan which included 200 camels
To pursue Kurz bin Jabir Al-Fihri who led a small group that looted Muhammad's animals
Attack a Quraysh caravan and gather information
Raid a Quraysh caravan carrying 50,000 gold Dinars guarded by 40 men, and to further Muslim political, economic and military position
Kill 'Asma' bint Marwan for opposing Muhammad with poetry and for provoking others to attack him
Kill Abu Afak for opposing Muhammad through poetry
Surprise attack on the Banu Salim tribe for allegedly plotting to attack Medina
Raid the Banu Sulaym tribe, no reason given in primary sources ( Possibly a continuation of the previous war)
Intercept and capture Quraysh caravan and its goods
December 624 William Muir, The life of Mahomet and history of Islam to the era of the Hegira, Volume 4, p. 14
Kill Abu Rafi' ibn Abi Al-Huqaiq for mocking Muhammad with his poetry and for helping the troops of the Confederates by providing them with money and supplies
Prevent Quraysh attack on weakened Muslim army
Muslims: 2 spies killed Non-Muslims: 3 beheaded, 3 captured
Attack Banu Asad bin Khuzaymah tribe after receiving intelligence that they were allegedly plotting to attack Medina
Kill Khalid bin Sufyan, because there were reports he considered an attack on Madinah and that he was inciting the people on Nakhla or Uranah to fight Muslims
Some men requested that Muhammad send instructors to teach them Islam,
The Mission of Amr bin Umayyah al-Damri
Attack the Banu Ghatafan tribe, because he received news that they were assembling at Dhat al-Riqa with a suspicious purpose
Attack the Quraysh led by Abu Sufyan, both sides were preparing to fight each other again at Badr
Invade Duma, because Muhammad received intelligence that some tribes there were involved in highway robbery and preparing to attack Medina itself
Muhammad orders Muslims to defend Medina from attack, after Banu Nadir and Banu Qaynuqa tribes form an alliance with the Quraysh to attack him as revenge for expelling them from Medina
Muslims: light casualties Non-Muslims: extremely heavy casualties
Muslims: 2 killed Non-Muslims: 600-900 beheaded (Tabari, Ibn Hisham) All Males and 1 woman beheaded (Sunni Hadith)

June 627 Muhammad Yasin Mahzar Siddiqi, Role of Booty in the economy during the prophets time, Vol. 1, King Abdul Aziz University , p.11. (archive), "In the sixth year of the hijrah (June, 627-May, 628A.D.) there were three ghazawa t but no booty was obtained from them. Of the 18 saraya, during this year only seven yielded any monetary or material benefits to the Muslims The very first expedition of the year i.e. Muhammad b. Maslamah's expedition..."
Attack Bani Bakr sept for booty/spoils
Attack Banu Assad bin Qhuzayma tribe to capture booty/spoils
Attack the Banu Thalabah tribe, because he suspected they would be tempted to steal his camels
No orders given by Muhammad, Amr ibn al-Akwa attacks Uyanah bin Hisn Al-Fazari after seeing him seize 20 of Muhammad's camels
1 Muslim shepherd killed, and his wife captured
To attack a group of men led by Uyanah bin Hisn Al-Fazari, who raided the outskirts of the Medina; and seized 20 of Muhammad's milch camels
To raid al-Jumum and capture booty/spoils
Attack Quraysh caravan and loot their camels
To raid Banu Thalabah and capture their camels as booty
Attack robbers who attacked Muhammad's envoy, Dhiyah bin Khalifah al-Kalbi
Heavy casualties inflicted, 100 women and boys captured by Muslims
Expedition of Zaid ibn Haritha (Wadi al-Qura)
December 627 William Muir, The life of Mahomet and history of Islam to the era of the Hegira, Volume 4, pp. 12-13.
Survey the area and to monitor the movements of the enemies of Muhammad

Attack Banu Mustaliq because Muhammad received some rumours that the Banu Mustaliq were preparing to attack him. The Banu Mustaliq also believed that Muhammad was preparing to attack them, both sides sent spies to confirm the reports, but the Banu Mustaliq spy was killed by Muslims, and then Muhammad told his followers to prepare for war
Muslims: 1 killed (friendly fire) Non-Muslims: 10 killed, 200 families taken captive
Expedition of Abdur Rahman bin Auf
Attack the Bani Sa‘d bin Bakr tribe, because Muhammad received intelligence they were planning to help the Jews of Khaybar
1 captured by Muslims, rest of tribe flees
Raid the inhabitants of Wadi al-Qura for revenge, because a number of Muslims were killed when they tried to raid the inhabitants previously, but failed
30 horsemen, and 1 women killed by Muslims Many captured by Muslims
Expedition of Kurz bin Jabir Al-Fihri
Capture 8 men who came to him to convert to Islam, but then killed one Muslim and drove off with Muhammad's camels
Muslims: 1 killed Non-Muslims: 8 tortured to death
Kill Al-Yusayr ibn Rizam because Muhammad heard that his group was preparing to attack him
To force the Jews of Fidak to surrender their properties and wealth(accepting his terms) or be attacked
Third Expedition of Wadi al Qura
Attack the Jews of Wadi al Qura to conquer their land
Many killed (at least 7 families killed ) by Muslims
Expedition of Bashir Ibn Sa’d al-Ansari (Fadak)
Attack for Banu Murrah tribe to capture booty
Muslims: 29 killed, Bashir wounded Non-Muslims: large amount killed
Expedition of Ghalib ibn Abdullah al-Laithi (Mayfah)
Attack the Banu ‘Awâl and Banu Thalabah tribes to capture booty (camels and flock)
Expedition of Ghalib ibn Abdullah al-Laithi (Fadak)
Everyone who came into contact with Muslims were killed
Expedition of Bashir Ibn Sa’d al-Ansari (Yemen)
Attack a large group of polytheists who Muhammad believed gathered to raid the outskirts of Madinah
Expedition of Ibn Abi Al-Awja Al-Sulami
50 men sent to demand the allegiance of the Banu Sualym tribe to Islam
Muslims: Most killed Non-Muslims: Most killed,
Expedition of Ghalib ibn Abdullah al-Laithi (Al-Kadid)
To raid the Banu al-Mulawwih tribe for booty
Large amount killed, and 1 captured by Muslims
Expedition of Shuja ibn Wahb al-Asadi
Raid the Banu Amir tribe to plunder camels for booty
Attack Banu Quda‘a tribe because Muhammad received intelligence that they had gathered a large number of men to attack the Muslim positions
Raid the inhabitants of Mut'ah, because one of Muhammad's messenger was killed by the chief of Ma’ab or Mu’tah
To subjugate the Banu Qudah tribe, and incite the tribes friendly to Muhammad to attack them, because of a rumour that the Banu Qudah were preparing to attack Medina and to improve Muslim prestige
Expedition of Abu Ubaidah ibn al Jarrah
Attack the tribe of Juhaynah and raid a caravan
To kill Rifa’ah bin Qays, because Muhammad heard they were allegedly enticing the people people of Qais to fight him
Expedition of Abu Qatadah ibn Rab'i al-Ansari (Khadirah)
Attack the Ghatafan tribe because he heard that they were amassing troops and were still outside the "domain of Islam"
Some killed, some captured by Muslims
Expedition of Abu Qatadah ibn Rab'i al-Ansari (Batn Edam)
To divert the attention from his intention of attacking Mecca, he despatched 8 men to attack a caravan passing through Edam
5 killed by Muslims: Abdullah b. Khatal Fartana (slave girl) Huwayrith b. Nafidh Miqyas b. Subabah Harith b. Talatil
To destroy al-Uzza because Muhammad wanted "the submission of neighbouring tribes" and wanted to eliminate "symbols reminiscent of pre-Islamic practices"
To destroy Suwa because Muhammad wanted "the submission of neighbouring tribes" and wanted to eliminate "symbols reminiscent of pre-Islamic practices"
Raid of Sa'd ibn Zaid al-Ashhali
To destroy Manat because Muhammad wanted "the submission of neighbouring tribes" and wanted to eliminate "symbols reminiscent of pre-Islamic practices"
Expedition of Khalid ibn al-Walid (Banu Jadhimah)
Invite the Banu Jadhimah tribe to Islam
Entire tribe taken prisoner, portion executed
Enemy defeated, many killed by Muslims
Chase the enemies who fled from the Battle of Hunayn
Muslims: 1 Killed Non-Muslims: 9 Killed . See footnote 128
Chase the enemies who fled from the Battle of Hunayn
At least 1 killed, men, women and children taken captives by Muslims
Attack enemies who fled from the Battle of Hunayn and sought refuge in the fortress of Taif
11 men, 21 women and 30 boys, captured by Muslims
Attack the Banu Khatham tribe to capture booty
Muslims: many wounded, some killed Non-Muslims: many wounded, some killed, some women captured
To call the Banu Kilab tribe to embrace Islam
Attack a group of Abyssinians (Ethiopians) who Muhammad suspected were pirates
Muhammad sent him to take revenge for the killing of the son of Abu Dhar Ghifari at al-Ghaba
Expedition of Ali ibn Abi Talib
Destroy al-Qullus, an idol worshipped by pagans
Many men, women and children taken captive by Muslims
Expedition of Ukasha bin Al-Mihsan (Udhrah and Baliy)
Attack the tribes of Udhrah and Baliy, no further details
Expedition of Khalid ibn al-Walid (Dumatul Jandal)
Attack the Christian prince of Duma.
Expedition of Abu Sufyan ibn Harb
630 Note: Source says this happened in the same year as the Battle of Tabuk which occurred in October 630
Demolish a mosque for promoting opposition
None (speculation that people may have been burnt )
Expedition of Khalid ibn al-Walid (2nd Dumatul Jandal)
Demolish an idol called Wadd, worshipped by the Banu Kilab tribe
Banu Abd-Wadd and Banu Amir al-Ajdar tribe members killed by Muslims
Ordered Surad ibn Abdullah (new convert) to war against the non-Muslim tribes in his neighbourhood
Heavy casualties, people of Jurash killed
Call on the people of Najran to embrace Islam or fight the Muslims
None, Banu Harith tribe surrenders and converts to Islam
Expedition of Ali ibn Abi Talib (Mudhij)
Attack the Banu Nakhla tribe to reduce them to submission
Expedition of Ali ibn Abi Talib (Hamdan)
To call the people of Hamdan to embrace Islam
Demolish the Temple of Dhul Khalasa worshipped by the Bajila and Khatham tribes
Local population "slaughtered" by Muslims, "destroying, burning and taking as many captives as they could"
